Karambwan paste is made by using raw, poison, or cooked karambwan with a pestle and mortar. The paste produced from a poison karambwan can be used to coat spears or hastae — but not daggers or partisans — with karambwan poison. A weapon coated with this poison will have the suffix (kp).

Karambwan poison deals 6 damage every 18 seconds (30 game ticks), which is the same starting damage as poison(++). If it is not reapplied to the target, the poison deals 1 less damage with each passing minute until the target is no longer poisoned when the damage would be 0.

Karambwan paste can be removed from a weapon with a cleaning cloth.

Total Poison damage[edit | edit source]

Total damage (D) is calculated by the sum of all numbers (n) up to the max hit (M), times the amount of hits per number (H=4).

D ( M ) = H ⋅ ∑ n = 1 M n = H ⋅ 1 2 M ( M + 1 ) = 2 ⋅ 6 ( 6 + 1 ) = 84 {\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}D(M)&=H\cdot \sum _{n=1}^{M}n=H\cdot {\frac {1}{2}}M(M+1)=2\cdot 6(6+1)=84\\\end{aligned}}}

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
26 November 2015
(update)

Spears poisoned with poisoned Karambwan paste will now be converted to the tradeable form and lost on death, and hence can be lost from your bank on Deadman worlds.

'''Karambwan paste''' is made by using [[raw karambwan|raw]], [[poison karambwan|poison]], or cooked [[karambwan]] with a [[pestle and mortar]]. The paste produced from a poison karambwan can be used to coat [[spear]]s or [[hasta]]e — but '''not''' [[dagger]]s or [[partisan]]s — with karambwan [[poison]]. A weapon coated with this poison will have the suffix [[(kp)]].

Karambwan poison deals 6 damage every 18 seconds (30 [[Game tick|game ticks]]), which is the same starting damage as [[Weapon poison(++)|poison(++)]]. If it is not reapplied to the target, the poison deals 1 less damage with each passing minute until the target is no longer poisoned when the damage would be 0.

Karambwan paste can be removed from a weapon with a [[cleaning cloth]].

==Total Poison damage==
Total damage (D) is calculated by the sum of all numbers (n) up to the max hit (M), times the amount of hits per number (H=4).

<math>\begin{align}
D(M) &= H\cdot\sum_{n=1}^{M}n = H\cdot\frac{1}{2}M(M+1) = 2 \cdot 6(6+1) = 84 \\
\end{align}</math>
